> The circuit in Figure P11–35 is in the steady state with v_1(t) =  10 cos 500t V. Find v_2SS(t).  
> Repeat for v_1(t) = 10 cos 1 kt V, and for v1(t) = 10 cos 10 kt V .  
> Where is the pole located?


KomponentID:

$$
R_1 = 1k\Omega\\
R_2 = 2k\Omega\\
C = 0.5 \mu F
$$

### Transfer function

Da det er en inverterende opsætning gælder flg. 

$$
T_V(s) = \frac{-Z_2}{Z_1}
$$

Hvor 
$$
Z_1 = R_1 \quad Z_2 = \frac{R_2 \cdot \frac{1}{Cs}}{R_2+\frac{1}{Cs}}
$$

Derfor:

$$
T_V(s) = \frac{-\left( \frac{R_2 \cdot \frac{1}{Cs}}{R_2+\frac{1}{Cs}} \right)}{R_1}
$$
Medfører: 
$$
T_V(s)= \frac{-R_2}{R_1(R_2Cs+1)}
$$

Med værdierne indsat:

$$
T_V(s) = \frac{-2000}{s+1000}
$$

Denne funktion har én pol: $p_1 = -1000\; rad/s$

### Impulse response

For at finde impulsresponenet:

$$
v_{impulse}(t)=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
T_V(s)
\right\}
=v_{impulse}(t)=
\mathcal{L}^{-1}\left\{
\frac{-2000}{s+1000}
\right\}
$$

Dette medfører:
$$
v_{impulse}(t)= -2000 e^{-1000t} u(t)
$$
